canonical.name: Kouan
canonical.title: 20. Kouan / Looking Down
canonical.judgment: Kouan shows how they whom it represents should be like the worshipper who has washed their hands, but not yet presented their offering; with sincerity and appearance of dignity, commanding reverent regard.
canonical.image: The trigrams representing the earth, and that for wind moving above it, form Kouan. The ancient kings, in accordance with this, examined the different regions of the kingdom, to see the ways of the people, and set forth their instructions.

1.text: shows the appearances of a child; not blameable in one of inferior level, but a matter for regret in a superior person.

2.text: shows one peeping out from a door. It would be advantageous if it were merely the firm correctness of a female.

3.text: shows one looking at the course of their own life, to advance or recede accordingly.

4.text: shows one contemplating the glory of the kingdom. It will be advantageous for them, being such as they are, to seek to be a guest of the king.

5.text: shows its subject contemplating their own life-course. Being a superior person, they will thus fall into no error.

6.text: shows its subject contemplating their character to see if it is indeed that of a superior person. They will not fall into error.

metadata.notes: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2
